ingredients: 1/4 cup sour cream or Greek yogurt
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add ground beef (or chicken) and cook until browned, breaking it up with a spoon. Drain off any excess grease.
Add onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Stir in garlic and jalapeno (if using) and cook for 1 minute more.
Add chili powder, cumin, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper. Cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Stir in cauliflower rice and diced tomatoes. Bring to a simmer and cook until cauliflower rice is tender, about 5-7 minutes.
Divide the mixture into bowls. Top with cheddar cheese, avocado, sour cream or Greek yogurt, and cilantro.
cooking_tips: For a spicier dish, add more jalapeno or a pinch of cayenne pepper.
You can substitute the ground beef or chicken with ground turkey or pork.
If you don't have cauliflower rice, you can use shredded lettuce or spinach as a base.
Add other keto-friendly toppings like salsa, guacamole, or shredded lettuce.
